description:
This is my first time Yelping. But I just wanted to say that I saved the receipt to put it in my journal...that's how good the food was. 

Garlic naan. Vegan Aloo Gobi. Paneer Tikka Masala. All so good!
author: Kristina C.

description:
I have tried 2 items from their Menu:

Veg Momo -Minced veggies inside(should be finely chopped) and tasted BAD
Veg Chowmein - No taste at all.

I personally think i wasted my money today.
author: Abhishek P.

description:
Updating the feedback. We got an email from the owner after we posted the feedback on Yelp and he admitted the mistake. They provided us with 3 boxes of veg momos and delivered it to my office without any charge. The momos were really tasty and were same as we wanted it to be. Thanks to Gorkha Kitchen and will definitely revisit you. 

My first experience with Gorkha Kitchen was really good, and I loved their momos, and that's why I decided that on my wife's birthday I will order momos from here. 

On 24th August 2018, I ordered six sets of Vegetarian Momos(1 set = 6 pieces), and I specifically mentioned that I want the Vegetarian Momos

Instead of giving us Vegetarian Momos these guys gave us three sets of non-vegetarian momos, and when we served those momos in front of our guests after the first bite, they realize something is wrong. 

We immediately called the restaurant, and they were not ready to accept there mistake.

Somehow we were able to manage the moment as the Party was already spoiled and tried to serve the other 3 set of Vegetarian Momos, the outer flour coating was so hard and thick, It was practically impossible to eat it.

Highly disappointed and I am not recommending this place to anyone.
author: Prashant L.

description:
The food is so delicious here! We ordered the chicken momo, butter chicken, plain & garlic naan, paneer tiki masala, aloo gobi, and vegetable briyani. Everyone loved the food and everything tasted so good. It wasn't too spicy, too over powering, the flavors were amazing.
In addition the place was clean, service was attentive, and the place did not having an overpowering food smell when you first walk in. I'm definitely coming back here again and again.
author: Irene L.

description:
I woke up starving! After a few nights of drinking, I needed some comfort food. Decided to order lunch / brunch from Gorkha Kitchen on Saturday, August 11th. I placed a delivery order through their website at 11:38am. It arrived at 12:47pm. I live in Outer Richmond.

*Everest Chicken Momo: Chicken dumpling filled with minced chicken, herbs and spices served with homemade fire-roasted tomato and sesame chutney ($7.95)
*Samosa: Mildly spiced potatoes and peas, served with extra mint sauce, 2 pcs, no tamarind sauce ($5.35)
*Chicken Tikka Masala: Boneless white meat chicken cooked to perfection in the tandoor, then simmered Indian classic sauce, Extra spicy ($13.45)
*Bullet Naan: Naan stuffed with chilies, garlic and cilantro ($2.95)
*Garlic Naan: Fluffy Naan with cilantro and a hint of roasted garlic ($2.95)

If you order through their site, some dishes are priced a little lower. The samosas are normally $5.95 and the tikka masala $14.95, so I saved $2.10 ordering through their site versus another delivery service. Just something to keep in mind if you want to get delivery from Gorkha.

I adored the naan. If was soft with a nice chew. And a good amount of garlic, chilis, etc. The tikka masala had a nice heat as I asked for it extra spicy. And it was nice and creamy. But I did find the curry a touch too sweet. The momos were good. The wrapper had a nice chew and they were very meaty. Also, that tomato and sesame chutney was very tasty. The samosas were crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. Very happy they gave me extra mint chutney as one side was enough for one samosa. I had enough for both.

Definitely fulfilled my Indian food craving. Such a great option when I need something warm and satisfying.
author: Elena N.

description:
Gorkha Kitchen is amazing Nepalese/Indian food in a really nice atmosphere. There are prayer flags hanging and good music playing. Unlike a lot of other SF restaurants, this one is relatively quiet and intimate. You get a free glass of wine with a yelp check in, and Gorkha Kitchen honors that. Their house wine is tasty and delightful to sip on.

The food is incredible, though! We ordered the chicken chili, buff momo, and naan to start. The momo was as you'd expect--flavorful and very mildly spicy. The chicken chili was the perfect amount of spicy and 100% delicious. For entrees, we got the goat curry dhal bat and the butter chicken. So, butter chicken is a really common thing that everyone's had a ton of, but this butter chicken is something else!!!! The chicken itself has a slightly charred, smoky taste to it and the sauce is creamy and sweet--this is the most crave-able chicken I've ever had. I highly recommend trying it, even if you're the type of person who likes to order more exotic dishes. The goat was also super tasty, and we loved the sautéed vegetables that came with it. 

I'd say the only bad thing is that they seem to be out of a lot of the desserts that they offer, but honestly, the food was so incredibly good that this didn't upset me and I'd easily still give this restaurant 5 stars.  

Overall, the service was awesome and the food was even better! I can't wait to become a regular at this place.
author: Claire C.

description: The taste is a solid 4 stars but the wait is a miserable 2 Stars. 6 dumpling appetizers took about 20 minutes to make. Then another 20 minutes went by before we got the first of our main dishes. There was nobody else in the restaurant and the staff were super nice but waiting that long to get our food seriously brought the entire experience way down. I think they should consider offering a lunch buffet like many Indian restaurants do. See pictures and descriptions for all of our dishes. Would recommend the Gorkha fried rice for $11.95
author: Cathrin P C.

description: Delicious food and awesome service. 100% recommendation. Very nice ambiance. If street parking is not available there is public parking on walking distance on 7th Avenue.
author: Maahi S.

description:
Great free delivery. First time was super late. Over an hour late (they called to let me know. But the next few were ok. Always friendly. I've never been to the restaurant. 

Love the CHICKEN TIKKA MASALA. Creamy and a little sweet and spicy. Really good. I might just order two of these and some rice next time!

The chicken curry has BONED chicken and is a little more watery but still very flavorful. Little salty 

Eggplant is super flavorful and not too oily. 

Butter chicken is super buttery. Good but a little too much for me. 

Chicken biryani was very good. Love it. It does come with nuts and raisins.  One time they took my request to not put those in. And one time the receipt clearly had handwriting to say no nut and raisins, but it was full of them.  So who knows.

Momos seem like any other Ive had so it's ok. 

They offer 10% off if you order directly from their site but I was out of their delivery radius on their site so I ordered through yelp instead (grubhub). I wish I could order from their site! 

I also ordered UberEats from here and that was a much faster delivery and a flat $4.99 delivery fee (no surge pricing time).  I'm sure the owner would prefer not to pay a commission but if you need some guarantee and tracking on your order, it might be easier to order UberEats.
author: Traci H.

description:
Nice little restaurant serving flavorful Indian and Nepali dishes. Nice ambiance as well...peaceful music...sound of water flowing.

They gave us complimentary papad. We had the malai kofta, paneer tikka and the momos which were all excellent. The owner/chef was a super nice person, I wish him the very best!
author: Sunil R.

description:
I'm going to rate this a 4.5 out of 5, but just give a usual 4 stars because I have a lot to say/review, even though I actually thoroughly liked and enjoyed this place overall.

Service: 5/5 So attentive, quick, warm, pleasant.
Ambience: 4.5/5: For an Indian place, this place is cleaner and newer. A mix of crowds was here which is always good. Not too noisy, not too hipster or Americanized. It felt authentic and also modern/clean.

Food: (4/5) Now I actually enjoyed the food, but this is where I critiqued a lot of items. We got:

1) Dal Bhat Thakari Platter (4/5). If you're not super sold on ordering a certain dish, I 100% recommend this. For $19, you get so many items, it's amazing. (Keep reading for my breakdown of every little thing you get). I'm also glad I got this for the IG Pics LOL. I was hella feeling those tiny metal bowls on a metal platter. This platter meal includes:
a) Curry - (5/5) Choice of goat, chicken, veggie. I chose chicken. This was my favorite. Tomato-based, sweeter, which I like. It wasn't thick so it was hard to put on top of the naan. The chicken however was so tender and melt in your mouth. It was an expected happy surprise. I've had some chicken curries where the meat was like a brick but it's usually all about the sauce so I'm fine. 
b) Dal - (5/5) Soup with lentils I believe. Yummy. Very easy to eat. 
c) Rice - (5/5) Nothing special. Didn't really need it since you also have naan. Carb overkill?!
d) Naan - (5/5) The naan was one of my favorite things. It wasn't extra fluffy like I normally like my naan, but it didn't feel lacking or plain either. I've definitely had worse naan. It was fresh and warm. It looked slightly greasy, but I couldn't stop eating it. Reminded me of Chinese green onion pancakes, my favorite. NOMNOM.
e) Vegetable of the Day (4.5/5) - Salad with SUPER creamy dressing. Totally overdressed, but still delicious for people who hate salads. I tend to underdress my salad to save calories. Wish the dressing came on the side.
f) Vegetable of the Day x2 (2.5/5) - It was a spinach dish that wasn't that bad actually. It was just so salty that I tried to wash it with water even. I wasn't trying to keep eating extra rice to compensate.
f) Chutney (0/5) - Spit this out. I thought chutneys were sweet. I'm Asian and I've had my fair share of super pickled, and/or spicy and/or fermented pungent things to eat with rice. I didn't like this at all. But that didn't bother me since it was so small and just extra.
g) Cup of Yogurt (4/5) Nothing special, but loved that it was provided. Tart yogurt yummy. I had to prioritize my stomach though so I didn't finish this.
h) Thali (4/5) - It doesn't say on the menu, but apparently the server told us that the platter came with a dessert/thali which happened to be rice pudding. Not the best rice pudding I've ever had but I LOVE rice pudding. It was different. It wasn't too sweet. It was perfect in terms of flavor. However, it was oddly cold (to the point of having some icicles in some parts) and had bits of coconut and other textural mysteries lol! But, the sweetness and flavoring was perfect!

2) The bf got the lamb vindaloo and a side of rice. It proved to be too much food for the both of us so we took most of his to go. The lamb vindaloo was (5/5). Yummy!
author: Josie W.

description: very good food, staff is very kind. I am from Nepal and the food is very authentic and tastes very good.
author: Nx R.

description: By far my favorite Indian place in San Francisco!!!Very clean, relaxing and the food were sooo goooood!! Fancy settings is a plus. I ordered Samosa for appetizer which was perfectly cooked. My mom ordered the Chicken Tandoori (juicy and flavorful) and  I ordered the Butter Chicken. Our meals came with side of lentil soup, naan, and salad. It was perfectly seasoned. I've been to other places where they put too much seasoning on their food in which you cant barely eat. ..but their food was just how I liked it. Texture and flavor def how it should be. Kumar our server was great! Excellent customer service. I'll definitely will be back and my family! We love this place!
author: Anne C.

description: Food taste here is amazing. Mo:Mo with spicy sauce was one of favorite of all. Very generous portion. Great customer service. One of the best Nepali restaurant in BayArea. Parking was hassle but that is typical in SF. Highly recommend to try some MO:MO and dal bhaat platter.
author: Bandana R.

description:
The rather slow service unfortunately resulted in a parking ticket. 
The food was OK.
We had the samosas, chicken momas, goat curry and paneer bread. Of those four I enjoyed the bread the most.
Overly attentive service. We had three people checking in on us. But yes, they are nice.
author: Camille L.

description:
Delicious!
We will definitely be back.
The dumplings were so good. Aloo gobi and bindi masala were terrific, too.
author: Theresa G.

description:
For what you pay: fair, copacetic. 
Ambiance: nice. Small tables in the front and large Indian style seating in the back.
Service: amazing. The people are so genial and happy.  Especially Lum! Our favorite server.
Taste: absolutely delicious. One of a kind 

Wowed my socks off. Left here craving it for another week. Came back the next day kind of good. Goodness that is heavy on your heart like young love. 

This Indian Himalayan joint outperforms in all categories consumers need. From the moment you walk in they have you at hello with a smile like good old cordial pals.  They remind me of that friend everyone has who is sumptuous in their pleasantries and peculiar in one way or another. Peculiar were their triangle hats they wore.  It just made it all the more enjoyable.  Later to find out these hats were reputed throughout Nepal as being worn by the Gorkha army and the small crosswords emblem pinned to it is a Gorkha army signature weaponry known as the Kukri.  The inward curved machetes are revered. The weapons are deftly wielded akimbo to a solider and the conspicuous look has made the Nepali military renown.  So now I imagine a blood crazed militant coming out with my goat curry and his Gorkha army hat.  Haha just kidding.  ;)

We were seated in the front tables which I believe is for the most casual diners. It seemed much more intimate in the back, Indian style seated cushions. No one was sorted about these, so I'm not sure if it must be a special request section. The front tables are nice enough: white table cloth with floriferous vases.  We were served some kind of large dried out cracker with a couple of sauces that were tangy and sweet. Our server was punctual and attentive.

Our food came out with a demanding demeanor, sizzling so every eye in the room  branded it to brain.  That would be the lamb shish kabob. Best lamb I've ever had. Thick, juicy tender flanks served over onion and pepper.  Highly recommend if your a shepherd of that sort of taste. I got the goat curry, hot and spicy the way I like it. Served over rice, the bites of goat and sauce amalgamate to a savory entree that will not go forgotten easily.

In the case that 'you should save money and not go out to eat' I would argue sometimes addictions are stronger than  convictions. This food is unique and cannot be made at home. I've yet to find a place like it.  Definitely going back


Update: after going vegan, this has become one of mine and my wife's favorite vegan places to eat. Many options, all savory and delectable, will have you curious to try more. Without regret tonight I deiscovered my favorite: the Chana Masala with roti and basmati rice.   Amazing. Huge portions and wonderful taste. Highly reccommend
author: Rob C.

description: We came here for lunch on a Saturday - the place was empty though there did seem to be a steady stream of takeout orders.  Unfortunately the service was horrible.  The bathroom was wet - literally the floor,the toilet paper, the paper towels, everything.  For my wife and kids it was unusable.  The food just took forever.  35 minutes to get appetizers and another 30 to get entrees.  The food was good - don't get me wrong.  The Indian sauces and naan were good and there was a Nepalese pot sticker type dumpling which was excellent.  But I won't be returning due to the awful service.  Hard to go to a restaurant where we can't use the bathroom.
author: Jeff M.

description:
This place is REALLY good! I come here to treat myself to their Himalayan Goat Curry Lunch Special for $12. They have a variety of other items as well and they all look delicious as they were passing me by on the way to other tables. 

The meat is rich and spices are aromatic, seasonings are earthy and just right.

If you love authentic Indian Food in a restaurant with pleasant ambiance, this is for you. Prices are in the median range, atmosphere nice enough to bring a date. 

Thank you Ghorka Kitchen!
author: Debra K.

description:
Good food. Attentive staff. Nice and casual.

We came here for Father's Day because my dad loves Indian food, and doesn't care for fine dining. The food was what Indian food should be: warm and comforting. The staff was friendly and accommodating. We felt comfortable and not rushed, and that matters when you want to spend time with your family.

We'll be back the next time my family visits.
author: Carlo T.

description: The sweet potato masala curry was fantastic! Rich in flavor, thick and creamy, and just the right amount of kick for my liking, and tender sweet potatoes to balance the spice. Ordered some garlic naan to eat it with. The naan was a great size and freshly baked. The vegetarian Biryani was so moist (I hate dry rice!) and I loved the mushrooms and caramelized onions. The only let down was the fish curry. It was lacking in flavor for us and we wished it had some spice to it. We didn't think it was worth the price tag of $20.
author: Lexi R.

description: I LOVE the vegan options here!!! AMAZING and I crave it all the time. It's like the first time every time, WONDERFUL! I get the vegan tofu saag, vegan Chana masala, and vegan aloo gobi with cumin rice and bullet naan and I ask them not to put butter on it. Amazing amazing! Thank you Gorkha!
author: CeeCee Y.

description:
Pretty chill casual ambience, could even be called a lil trippy: they're serious about the Nepalese Himalayan high altitute light-headed feeling. 
Hospitality: warm, hospitable, sincere.
Organic Gorgha chicken: seriously over cooked and seriously expensive!
Dal bhat platter: seriously great tasting and serious value for money!
Momo sauce: seriously, could be spicier, Californians can handle it! 

i'll be back, in the long term. Food is authentic nepalese. very light, walk away feeling like you're walking amongst clouds, on everest
author: Raj R.

description:
I'm really sad to write this review, and it's about the service not the food.

We have been coming here since they opened (as you can see from our previous 5 start review), and the service and food used to be fantastic.  While the food is is still great, the service has become so offensive we will not be coming back.   

One of the male servers starting asking us every week for cash tips instead of tipping on the credit card, and while we tip well,  we seldom carry cash.  After 5 consecutive weeks of asking for cash, we asked that he doesn't ask us anymore because we felt it was a rude way to end the meal.  Clearly, we offended him.  Our last trip in, he ignored us and another server waited on us.  When I asked for another drink, he nodded his head, walked away, started bussing tables, and never brought the drink.   We saw him ask another table for a cash tip, and the man left the restaurant and returned 10 minutes later after a trip to the ATM to provide a cash tip as requested.  Not really the way someone wants to end a meal, and such poor customer service.

Lastly, on our last trip in at 908PM a family of five arrived wanted to be seated.  This server turned them away stating the kitchen was closing.  Mind you, they close at 10pm. This was well before closing.  I 

Clearly, they do not appreciate their customers and we will not be returning unless they address their service.
author: Ashley + Kelvin Q.

description:
This is my first time eating Indian food.
Highly recommend.
Very clean place and friendly service.
author: Boris G.

description:
This place reminds me of Ambrosia's in Monterey County... my favorite Indian cuisine. 

The food was delicious and prepared well with love. Came out in beautiful gold bowls that made the whole dining experience feel authentically traditional and warm. 

The service was also great! The waiter and the whole staff came around and checked on us plenty of times to see if everything was ok. 

Overall... dining experience was excellent.
author: Anh L.

description:
So happy to find a new Indian restaurant that delivers to me (Outer Sunset).

My bf and I both worked long days on our anniversary. We had planned a nice dinner and maybe a chill concert afterwards but were just too tired on a Monday.  I suggested take-out and a Netflix movie instead.

After browsing the age old pizza, Thai, Chinese, etc delivery options (at least we have more than just pizza - thank god for city living), I suggested Gorkha Kitchen since they delivered to us, served Nepalese cuisine (a new for both of us), and traditional Indian fare.

First time having chicken momo's and I'm in love! Deliciously plump and full of flavor, nicely complemented with the spiced dipping sauce. The Indian Platter was amazing and supplied a nice Thali-ish feel to the meal. I love having the option of several curries and sauces without having to order full sized dishes of each,  NEVER REMOVE THIS OPTION!!!

The American *gold* standard tikka paneer was amazing, slightly sweet with just a hint of spicy. Yum, hands down my fav.  Large pillowy naan justifies the higher than normal price point.

And the delivery - on par. Yelp estimated 30-40 mins, driver rings door at 41 mins.

This made my anniversary relaxing and memorable. I will definitely order from here again, and not just for special occasions :)
author: Kimiko Q.

description:
Best Indian food in SF! 
The portions were plenty big and every dish knocked it out the park. 
The staff is really A+ at this place. Our waiter as well as the other staff were super attentive the whole time we were there. Kushou was our waiter and took excellent care of us! No rush to leave, just great service!

Can't hype this place enough.
author: David J.

description: Yummy yummy butter chicken! Huge garlic naan and nice service. Super quiet on a Monday night. Definitely could have split it, but I'm not complaining to have left overs!
author: Brigid M.

description: Best Momos I have ever had in USA!! We went there for lunch on a silent Monday afternoon and ordered Vegetarian Chili Momos and lunch special Mutter Paneer. Chili Momos were out of the world, it was perfectly fried, filling and the sauce were delicious. Mutter paneer was very creamy and delicious too. The lunch special came with dal, naan, rice and salad. The quantity was huge for the price!! I highly recommend this restaurant and would definitely visit again!!
author: Sriganesh C.

description:
We ordered the chicken took a Masala and Gorkhe's goat curry, garlic nana bread and basmati rice. Did the free glass of wine. Red cab it was just so-so.
The food was so flavorful, not too spicy, severed warm, friendly staff, intimate ambiance - not noisy, relaxed environment and  the music was true to its worldly location. Clean too. Will come back again. Highly recommended this restaurant. Reasonable prices. $47 for our early dinner tonight.
author: Richard D.

description:
It's our first time to dine in here for our post father's day celebration. At first the closed sign is still up so I have to call to check & they said "we just opened right now". We were the first customers for the day & it took time for them to serve our orders and they said that since we are the first customers the kitchen is still preparing our food. The next customers came in right after 25 mins we ordered our food; next thing you know they got their food ahead of us (surprisingly!). They offered us the mango lassi for our lil one. However, I don't like the idea of the server touching my lil one's nose w/out asking if it's ok (yes, i'am so protective). When it's time for us to pay for our food the server evidently told us to tip them with cash; that cash is better (smh). 

Food - average
Service - better luck next time
Do we plan to visit the place again? - maybe
author: Kathy C.

description:
This is one of my best resturant when comes to Indo- Nepalese food in san francisco .
As a resturant manager My self I am very pickky when comes to personnel hygiene
Love their Tofu saag & palak paner very much and they are very neat & clean .
Love this place.Highly recommend to any one.
author: Anil P.

description:
As someone who grew up on momos (Nepali dumplings), I absolutely loved Gorkha's buff and chicken chili momos! While the steamed momos were juicy, the fried chili momos were fiery and crispy. And the goat curry, with the Nepali Thali, was to die for! I definitely recommend the thali and the steamed buff momos! 

Gorkha Kicthen is a PoC owned restaurant with the best Bollywood music and super sweet staff!
author: Seerat J.

description:
The chili chicken was disappointing and the chicken momos were about the least tasty we ever had. We tried many, including in the Himalayas, alongside the Nepal-India border.

The biggest issue was the service, the attitude. I had ordered a specific beer from San Francisco. It has a red/orange color. The waiter brought me a beer. It was blond. I asked him if it was the brand I ordered. He started by saying yes then saw that I was not duped. He offered to change it and I told him that I would drink the one he brought.

I would not have reported this little incident if there was nothing else. 

We had ordered four different dishes, including momos. The momos were supposed to be appetizers and arrived last. No problem. However when we asked for clean plates to eat them, the waiter first refused to give us any. 
In fact, he walked away. Clearly ignoring our request. After 5 minutes, I called him back. He said that they only provide side plates for appetizers. It took some arm twisting to get an extra plate. Bizarre dialog in a restaurant.

Not only the food was mediocre but the service was poor, very poor.

It spoiled the experience. We won't go back there.
author: Dominique T.

description: The momo are delicious, and so are the various sauces. First time there but we look forward to returning to try some specials and curries.
author: Eekie P.

description:
Nice restaurant with no wait on a friday night which was awesome by the way. The menu was majority indian.

Food:
Spicy momo - I have never had momo before and I have to say i loved it! I am a sucker for dumplings though. The spicy sauce it was drenched in was absolutely delicious
Samosa - was ok. Not a huge fan of samosas in general but my hubby did like it and said the chutneys were good
Butter chicken - silky smooth, creamy, buttery deliciousness. The chicken was cooked perfectly and this dish was sooo tasty
Lamb Saag - Needed some salt big time. Spinach is one of those ingredients that if it's not seasoned with salt while cooking, it'll turn out really bland and that's what happened here. The lamb was also overcooked a tad and became a little tough. I will say though, when I took this home for leftovers and had it the next day, it was spicier - maybe the spices didn't come through right after cooking but the next day it was packed with flavor. 

Service:
Really really really slow. They were nice but I think they were just understaffed and the place was mostly full. It took a really long time to get our order in and then it took even longer to get our food. We were definitely starving by the time our food came out. There was a couple next to us that actually just left because they were getting frustrated with the wait.

Overall, not the best indian food I've ever had but there were some good dishes that made it an enjoyable experience.
author: Lisa D.

description:
I love this place. It's a cute little restaurant and it seems like they have family seating in the back(?).
First, we had the buffalo dumplings and they were really good. Loved the dipping sauce that it came in. 
We later ordered a lamb dish and butter chicken. The butter chicken was so good and creamy. I def see myself having this dish quite often. The lamb dish felt a little over done and maybe I'll try something else next time. 

The service was okay. I think that it was slow because there was a good amount of people. I don't think that I would've came here if I were more hungry.
author: Mariana V.

description:
I just had lunch at Gorkha Kitchen. It was just perfect. I had the goat lunch special. I asked for spicy, and it was nice and spicy, but not too much, so you can still taste the food. The naan, rice, lentil soup, and small salad all tasted delicious, also nice and fresh. Service was excellent, just the right amount of attention.
I was happy to dine there, and will do so again soon.
Oh, almost forgot, the setting and music are comfortable and relaxing!
author: James P.

description: I ordered delivery and specifically asked for mint chutney which was not delivered. I called and asked if they could have the guy come back and deliver mint chutney. He told me to drive there to pick it up. First of all, I ordered delivery for a reason, I don't want to spend 30 mins trying to find parking. I also tipped before the delivery through the app which was a huge mistake. I will not order delivery from here again or eat at this restaurant. The chicken tikka masala isn't any good but the lentils are ok. I'd rather get food from Keeva or Saffron Grill.
author: Jared Y.

description:
My new favorite Indian spot in the city. Extremely friendly staff, calm atmosphere, and food is AMAZING. We ordered some vegetarian appetizers and they were pretty. The main course was flames and they're super accommodating to the level of spicy-ness you want! 

Oh and the mango lassi is a MUST HAVE! I could just order a gallon of this if I could.

I enjoyed our early dinner here and will definitely be coming back.
author: Rayne J.

description: I got butter chicken. It was burnt tandoor chicken not the usual butter chicken that is falling apart. Honestly the whole dish just tasted burnt. Wouldn't go back considering how many great Indian options are within a square mile.
author: Amy J.

description: Great little place a few blocks down the hill from UCSF.  This is my second time here, sneaking food to a friend in the hospital.  lol. The food is great, the restaurant is clean, and the staff is very nice.  My only complaint is that they don't serve paneer pakora.  Their veggie pakora are these great little balls, not a piece of veggie deep fried.  They're awesome!  I haven't used their delivery service, but if I lived here I totally would!  Parking is tough, so cab or UBER.  Street parking, if you can find it, accepts credit cards. Score!
author: Stacy L.

description: With Jiska: Very tasty dishes (paneer tikka masala, butter chicken, paneer saag, chicken vindaloo(?)); naan was ok.  Service was friendly.  Food seemed to come out slow, but it might have been our kids asking ;-) overall a good experience.
author: Peter and Julie H.

description: Really great food! I recommend only for takeout ... service in restaurant can be fairly slow.
author: dee b.

description:
My only previous experience with Himalayan food was Bini's Kitchen in FiDi, which was...okay. Gorkha was my second experience with Himalayan, that all-important opportunity where life-long opinions are made. One bad experience with a new cuisine is bad luck, two, of course, is a pattern. I am happy to report that Gorkha was my third experience with Himalayan, as well as my fourth. This place is delicious.

The decor is really cool. Understated, but it's got a style to it. The staff were attentive and prompt, no doubt helped by the fact that the place is always weirdly empty. I always get the bullet naan. I can't even remember what's on it; all I know is the waiter brings it out, there's a hole in my memory, then it's all gone and I'm smiling. And y'know what, I'm perfectly happy with that.

The first time I went, I got...something. I don't remember because my dining partner got the chicken biryani. I tried that and immediately forgot what I ordered. I remember my own dish being good, but the biryani was incredible. It was a delicious mix of rice, countless herbs and spices, tender chicken, and a spicy mystery sauce that sealed the whole thing together perfectly. I always ask for another serving or two of the sauce before I leave.

They've got a pretty classy-looking wine bar too, but I still think Franzia is palatable so I am absolutely not the person to comment on that.

In summary, delicious food, reasonable dinner prices, great service, and a huge menu full of delicious-sounding things. It's close to my place so I'll definitely be back again, but even if it weren't it'd be well worth a trip.
author: Shawn W.

description:
The food was amazing. Some of the best Indian/Nepalese food I've had in the Bay Area. I ordered the Nepalese combination dinner (like thali) with chicken. Everything was great. Especially loved that they served a salad with it. And the spinach with the toasted cumin seeds was delicious. I'm fussy about eating meat, and the chicken tasted of good quality. Somewhere else on the menu I saw that they served organic chicken. 

The reason I did not give 5 stars is because the bathroom was absolutely disgusting filthy. It looked as though it had not been cleaned in a year. It was worse than some gas station bathrooms in which I've been. The rest of the restaurant was lovely, I was not expecting to enter such squalor upon opening the bathroom door. They really must do something about this. Ladies - my advice - avoid using the bathroom at all costs.
author: Lisa M.

description:
I think I've finally found the best indian restaurant in the inner sunset! Naan and curry please move aside! This place is very clean and the staff is attentive. They know their menu inside and out and the free glass of wine upon check in is a nice touch.

 I highly recommend the Momo's. They are himilayan style dumplings. The way they serve the Momo's is with crispy skin and a spicy sauce over it. It's such an interesting taste that I can't get enough of. Another great dish is their famous butter chicken. If you go there, you must get it. It is just so moist and tastes wonderful!

 I will definitely go back to try the rack of lamb. Another table had just gotten theirs as I was leaving and the aroma drew me in. Too bad I was already full from my meal. Next time though!
author: Jessica L.

description: Amazing food, quick service and indeed a great find. We went in for their Chilli momos , which was so delicious but we were surprised with the quality of their Lunch platter. 10$ for a big serving of Matter Paneer+ Naan + Dhal + Jeera rice and a salad ! Very impressed and will definitely go back for their tasty food
author: Nandhini R.

description: Awesome Bhindi Masala! I was really craving some and have lost faith in a lot of delivered food but this hit the spot :) Perfect level of spiciness and great flavor. Complements to the chef :)
author: Tan S.

description:
One of my favorite Nepalese restaurant.
I mostly order from here and delivery service is always on time.
My all time favorite is Gorkha Organic Chicken Curry, Everest Chicken Momo, Goat Sekuwa and Kathmandu style Chowmein.
"Food here makes your taste buds happy."
author: Chanda B.

description:
Came here while in town for a work trip with a friend from college who knows the hole in the wall restaurants of SF better than anyone I know. He chose this place. It was early so we had the place to ourselves. I do not know exactly what we ordered but I know we had the gobbi manchurian (super spicy), a cheese masala, and a spinach dish as well.

Service was good. They left a pitcher of water when I asked. I would definitely go back here. So yummy!
author: John B.

description:
Gorkha Kitchen offers Indian, Himalayan/Nepalese fare. besides momos, i wasn't interested in anything else, didn't want to order indian fare. 2nd waiter insistent i order a main. said i wasn't hungry, finally ordered something. that's why their ratings went down. 

offerings: besides momos, rest of menu looks indian. menu doesn't classify.

eats:"Buff momo of mahaboudha" (8/10)
-dumpling filled with buffalo meat, herbs & spices served with fire roasted tomatoes and sesame chutney"
*`tasty spicy buffalo meats in dumplings with yummy dipping sauce. 4 stars

Lamb shish kebab(16)
-10 pieces kebab on an iron hot plate. meat dry. (twice cook meats, too dry.)
lemony, gingerly dipping sauce can't save this dreadful dish.

take outs:
-waiters wanted more orders, drinks, etc.
-nice atmosphere, management pushing sales too much...
author: Victor G.

description: Worst service and poor quality food. Took parents on mother's day and was such a disappointment. Do not recommend and will not be back.
author: Arshi K.

description: Awesome Butter Chicken, Garlic Naan, and Samosas. Delivery was really quick and everything was hot. Delivery driver was really friendly and brought the food up the stairs for me since I have an injury. Would definitely order from them again. Much better than Naan N' Curry up the street, and not that much more expensive.
author: Joey K.

description: Amazing food! Highly recommend sharing since the portions are large. We shared the Everest Chicken Momo for an appetizer then the Butter Chicken with Bullet Naan as our meal. My husband and I were more than full.
author: Kari M.

description: Best nepalese restaurant in SanFrancisco hands down! If you have not tried it yet please give it a shot. Taste is super authentic.
author: Sean K.

description:
Fantastic food and service. Best damn Chicken Tiki Masala I've ever had.

This restaurant is a welcome addition to the Sunset. Walking in you'll see there are both tables and traditional on the floor seating. Very cool and authentic. We sat on the floor tables and enjoyed it. The cushions are comfortable, but be warned you will want to stretch your legs out at some point.

The service is friendly and fast. The server recommendations when we went were on point. We ordered (among others)

1) Chicken Tiki Masala (amazing, thick and flavorful sauce) 
2) Gobi Munchurian (delicious cauliflower dish)
3) Gorkha's Goat Curry (fantastic)
4) Garlic and bullet naan (YUM)
5) Coconut rice

All the dishes were amazing. I highly recommend!!
author: Mikey J.

description:
Currently, I'm eating a take out meal from Gorkha Kitchen, butter chicken and plain naan, and I couldn't help but bust out my laptop to start on writing this 5 star review.

I'm so thrilled to see a top notch indian restaurant in my hood. Time and time again, there have been multiple indian restaurants that come and go. However, i have a feeling Gorkha Kitchen is  going to be a business that will remain open for a long time.

First off, the quality of the food is amazing. The chicken is organic which not only is healthier, but also tastes better. It definitely ranks a 5 out of 5 for quality!

Secondly, the service went beyond my expectations. I ordered take out via Eat 24 App and the estimated pick up time was 2:30pm. I received a call at 2:10pm saying that the order was ready. It's a small gesture that really makes a huge difference.

Overall, an amazing take out experience and I am looking forward in dining here some time soon.
author: Briana H.

description: The food is 4 stars but delivery is no good. 40 minute estimate? More like 90 minutes. If you're really starving either take out or go there.
author: Abdul K.

description:
My friend has passed by this place many times before. He was hesitant to try it, because the windows were blacked out and he could not see inside. Would he be eating alone, or was it full of satisfied diners?

We decided to bite the bullet and give them a try. I was glad to see there were many other people eating here with us. We were greeted warmly and escorted to a table. If you dine in the very back of the restaurant, you can sit low to the floor on cushions.

I was expecting a straight Indian restaurant from how my friend described it. No, they also serve Himalayan/Nepalese food here. And that's a good thing.

Looking at the menu, we started with the Buff Momo. Then we ordered the Half Moon Bay Salmon Tikka, Goat Biryani, and a garlic naan.

If you like pot stickers, you will love the Buff Momo. The big difference is that these are stuffed with buffalo meat, and served with a side of sesame chutney. I really liked it. I'm not sure if it tasted better with or without the chutney. Try it and decide for yourself.

The Goat Biryani came with ample portion of rice. The meat was rather bony, but what was there was very tender. We were both hoping for boneless chunks of goat.

The garlic naan was excellent. Just a little crispy, without being doughy.

I was really looking forward to the Salmon Tikka, which was cooked in a tandoor. It's one of my favorite Indian dishes if cooked well. But this was disappointing. There was a good portion of fish on the plate, but that was about it. The salmon was definitely overcooked and a little on the dry side. Some of the vegetables on the platter were more than a little burnt on the edges too. 

I love the blackened onions which stick to the bottom of the metal platter when I order fajitas. Given the condition of the vegetables, I was expecting to pick off a lot of them. But there were only a few onions like that to scrape off.

Service was excellent, their staff were very friendly.
author: The Bottomless Pi T.

description:
I tried this restaurant 3 times now. I have found it that they have amazing food quality and service. 
We ordered goat curry, bengal shrimp, organizing chicken curry and garlic naans. I also tried their thali when I visited by myself. 
It is fresh and too tasty. 
The restaurant is too clean and well decorated. I always check restrooms of the restaurants. I grade the perfect for everything.
author: Somnath R.

description: Fair prices and portions, very friendly staff, and lovely decor. It has a cultural feel, especially if you sit in the back where you remove your shoes and eat on the floor. The regular tables are great too, very comfy chairs. I was very impressed with the amount vegan options! The okra masala was the best I've had, dal tadka was average, the vegetable biryani was good but very heavy on ginger. I got a couple of bites with whole pieces of ginger that was too overwhelming. The naan was disappointing, it was a bit crispy and flaky instead of soft. That said, I'll probably be back to try a couple more dishes.
author: Michelle B.

description:
Our new favorite restaurant in the Inner Sunset.

We through we'd try a new experience. We ordered the Everest chicken momo, bengal shrimp, chicken Tikka Kebab and goat Sekuwam. Everything was absolutely delicious, savory and cooked just right; eg the chicken and goat were tender and moist.  This was my first time trying goat, and I'm sold.

The owner and the staff were very kind and gracious; true to their Nepalese kind. We'll definitely be back for more and this time we'll invite friends.

Thank you,
Stephan
author: Stephan A.

description: This is a 3.5 star review--the space was nice, the wait staff was kind, but the food lacked flavor when compared to other Indian food restaurants I've visited. Additionally, the wait for food was longer than I would have liked...in the future, I definitely would order ahead for pick up, rather than try to sit and eat. The restaurant was pretty empty on a Friday night around 7:30, and despite the fact that most tables had already ordered by the time we arrived, our food still took far too long to reach our table after we ordered (around 20 minutes after ordering for appetizers to make their way to us).
author: Sangay S.

description:
Gorkha was okay. It's got fancy decor with fancy chairs and tables and nice servers. We came around 5:30 on a Saturday and it was empty except for one other table. Filled up later on though. Despite being super empty for most of the time, the food took a looooooong time (30+ minutes!!) to come out, which made me pretty hangry.

Chicken momos were good. Chicken tikka masala was creamier than others I've had and quite good. Decent portion size, but a tad pricier than what I'm used to ($15). Mango lassi was average, garlic naan was also average and nothing to write home about.

Overall I was pleased with the food but it did end up being pretty pricey and the long wait kinda ruined the experience for me a little :(
author: Grace D.

description:
All three of us agreed they had the best momos we've ever had!
Palak paneer was on point.
Manchurian cauliflower was really spicy. 

But the best part is that we had it delivered and they were so so nice, even when I gave the wrong address! We'll definitely be back for more.
author: Elizabeth x.

description: Not good service! Was there at 9:30 but they said they were closed and we followed the google map which said closing time was 10pm.
author: Dhiraj P.

description:
Fantastic restaurant with great food !!!
wonderfully setting Nepali restaurant served mouth watering buff Momo 
 & Gorkha Chicken Curry. Goat Sekuwa was excellent flavors and cooked to perfection and great compliments to chilled Beer.

A classy wine bar. The service was amazing.....fantastic.. will be there soon.
author: Meshy S.

description:
EXCEPTIONAL!!!!!!!!
I had a dinner last week with my friends and we were fully satisfied with Gorkha kitchen family and their Hospitable environment, friendly  kind servers and absolutely wonderful food . I was happy to find emphasis towards organic, fresh foods. Thanks again we will be back sooon
author: Sha C R.

description: Listen.....I had to come back to the same restaurant. Today, I ordered Lamb Rogan Josh with Cabuli Naan which is a lavendered Naan stuffed with cashews and raisins. Of course I had to order the cumin rice as well. Let me tell you guys, I ate this dish like it was my last meal. The lamb stew was thick and hearty, just the right amount of spices and heat to bring everything together. I gluttonously ate that food   without a care in this world. It's like I was transported into another world where only myself and the delicious food were the only survivors. You have to try this restaurant. Oh....delivery is spot on. If they say they will be there at a certain time, they will be there to the minute. I am impressed. Two thumbs up!!!!
author: Julie K.

description: Good service, clean place and solid food. I tried the chicken tikka masala, vegetable biryani and bullet naan. Everything was solidly good and quite fresh, but nothing extraordinary. Our waiter was very attentive and nice as well. Would definitely come back or order take out again!
author: Sarah S.

description:
I've been missing good Indian food fiercely, and was really excited to try this place, after hearing both good and mixed things from neighbors.
A couple of the items on the menu wasn't available.

I've never had momos before, Indian dumplings, so I started with chicken momos.
As I finished the second bite I realized the texture was more like sushi than it should be, so I cut one open.
The chicken was completely raw. Not under cooked. Raw.

When the goat curry and paneer nan came I had completely lost my appetite, so I had it to go.

The explanation for the chicken was untrained kitchen staff.

They comped my tea - I dunno, I'm not used to complaining at restaurants but I think a health hazard such as raw chicken warrants the entire meal comped - I paid  $30 including 20% tip, for curry, nan and rice.
author: Kat B.

description:
The Inner Sunset has a decent selection of Indian restaurants, but Gorkha is unique. Their menu is a mix of Indian and Himalayan dishes, including curries, momo dumplings, tandoori meats (and cauliflower), and rice dishes like biryani. Peruse the appetizer menu for some unique dishes. We called them up for takeout and they were very professional and friendly. Prompt order processing and well within the estimated time frame.

Because we're crazy for momos, we ordered their momo chili with chicken, buff momo of Mahaboudha (buffalo), and sakahari (vegetable) momo (6 nicely sized momos per order). We also got some curries on the side (no rice included--you'd have to order it separately). The chili momo is likely deep fried and doused in their sweet, tangy chili sauce--a bit too similar to a sweet and sour sauce for our liking, but the filling was generous, chivey and herbal. The buffalo momos are good for carnivores because they're pretty much just packed with meat, and contain the rich, juicy flavors you'd expect from buffalo. The veggie momos contained spinach, herbs, and paneer.

As far as the curries go, they are creamy, aromatic and not overly spicy, and generous with the fillings (e.g., goat meat, tofu). The Gorkha goat curry is a tomato and onion based curry, similar to a rogan josh curry, and the meat practically fell off the bone. The saag tofu curry had some heat and the tofu comes crisped.

Overall, a good experience. There are cheaper options for Indian food in the Sunset, but Gorkha creates a bit more ambiance and is worth experiencing for some classics made with quality as well as unique dishes.
author: Jade V.

description: I came here with some friends for their grand opening and had their tasting menu. The staff was very accommodating and they were able to answer our questions about the menu. Overall, thee food was good (not the best). It definitely was more of the sweet side and lacked some spiciness to their curries. I would only come back here using their 25% off promotion because their portion sizes aren't very big and they are a little lacking on the spices and flavors.
author: Lynn T.

description:
Pros: Relatively nice decor.
Cons: Everything else. The waiter was so unaware of the menu and couldn't pronounce "Pina colada". I couldn't even order it because the bartender was on a two hour break (wtf) and only he can make it (this place markets itself as a restaurant and BAR). I ordered the chicken kebobs and they came out so rubbery and tough in texture I left worried I was going to be food poisoned. Lastly, we gave hIm two cards to split the bill and he came back and stated, "I accidentally charged only one card." I think he just didn't know how to charge two separate cards tbh.  

Overall I would never return and would not recommend this place.
author: Michael V.

description:
airline steward hats but this ain't united
so no worries you won't get dragged out the restaurant or falling scorpions

owait "m night himalayan" is that the mantra?
nah brah the wifi password; we're not savages

dishes interesting mix of indian & himalayan adds up to more than the sum of its parts #twss

(^_^) Tofu Saag $12 / Palak Paneer $14 ()
creamed spinach etc

(^_^) Tandoori Chicken $14 ()
ssssssmokinnn!

(^_^) Goat Biryani $15 ()
bony bones but tender meat

(^_^) "Crispy Tubes" Appetizer $0 ()
dat light crunchy texture

(-_^) Buff Momo Of Mahaboudha $10 ()
gyoza skins could've been lil less doughy nbd

(-_^) Bread Basket Assortment $7 ()
variety's the way to go

plucking harp(?) music the whole time
hometown handmade cloths across the walls
q2chick employee
i'd return to try more; maybe round up to 4
author: Dan B.

description:
Off to a great start, Gorkha Kitchen!!

I came last Friday during their grand opening (4.21.17) and it was flooded with neighborhood patrons ready to support this event.  From students/residents/doctors at UCSF to neighbors that grew up in The Sunset (myself included), it was a fun evening getting to try new food and meet new friends.  The generous owner even offered a special 3-course grand opening tasting for only $8!  It was the first time I had a chicken momo (reminds me of a XLB) and it was delicious!!  Each tasting came with 2 entrees (4 to choose from), along with rice and naan, ending the evening with dessert (2 to choose from).  Everything was tasty with the perfect amount of heat/spices given that I cannot take spicy.  I appreciated the offerings of not only quality organic meats but also the fresh taste on the vegetarian dishes as well.  I couldn't stop eating the tofu saag, I usually like my poultry but that was probably my favorite entree that evening. 

Not only were the prices great, but we left very full with food still left on the table.  It was a very satisfying meal and if you picked up a flier on your way out, there's a 25% off coupon for your next visit. :)

Aside from the usual table/chairs seating...towards the right hand back corner of the restaurant, there's also floor seating with comfy pillows and cushions where you take off your shoes.  We got to sit in this part of the room and it was fun!  Met a lot of new friends sitting in the same area, we chatted while waiting for our food.  The owner shared with us that this is more of a traditional Northern style and it's great, really brings family and friends together.   

The owner himself was overwhelmed with the outpouring support.  While most customers waited patiently to be seated or get their food/bill, some had tired looks on the faces.  I'm sure the special pricing drew a lot of attention with the crowd and while dinner service was a bit longer than usual, it was expected for the first night.  The owner and staff were all hustling, doing their best to make sure things were running smoothly.  They were very apologetic and the owner himself came over several times to each table to check on everyone.  That's very commendable given that I overheard him say they ran out of food twice already in the course of the day.  However, he kept going and making sure his supplies got replenished yet with the utmost quality of food.  

I got a chance to look at their regular menu as well and am excited to come back and try other things on the menu.  They will be offering both a la carte and tasting menu which I think are both great ways to introduce customer that are unfamiliar to Himalayan/Nepalese cuisine.  They are currently still in the process of getting their beer and wine license but everything else seems to be falling into place.  

Cheers Gorkha for being a new addition to the neighborhood!
author: Janetto L.

description:
5 stars from my side for this unique place. So glad to see this logo of "symbol of peace", we thought of stepping in and try some Himalayan food. We tried chi mo:mo and Kathmandu style chowmin noodles. This was exceptionally awesome.
         I look forward to give a try some other Himalayan dishes here next time. Thank you Gorkha Kitchen.
author: Feroz C.

description:
Super amazing food!  We're tourists from socal and was walking by.  Wanted to try something new!  

The server was super helpful, making recommendations and everything!

10/10, would come again!
author: Kevin D.

description: Liked the food and atmosphere.  As others have reported, The service is lacking. Waiter to get and pay the bill. But we came for the food so I was okay. We also had delivery service which was fine.
author: Ron G.

description:
This restaurant is very unique, probably the best ambiance and service in sunset area. Their menu is huge and great selection of wines. What? Free wine on yelp check in! 
My wife and i tried roasted cumin chicken, goat curry, garlic naan and momo chili. Everythig is amazing. If they work abit harder, this must dunk michelin star next year.
author: Rc K.

description: This is a new place in to the neighborhood. Gorkha refers to one of the Himalayan people & the wait staff wears Gorkha symbol (2 knives crossed) on their hats.  Service 5 , physical plant 4 , food - 3  and price 1 . Same food is better at 1/2 the price at Naan N Curry about a block away. Zero ambiance and no service at NNC but food & price way better.
author: Leung T.

description: The all indian and nepali food has great taste i really like momos and all curry i tried their had great taste i really love the food and service provided by them. I hoghly recommonded other to try gorkha kit
author: Bhupal K.

description:
The food was tasty, though for the price I was expecting a bit more, but hey, this is San Francisco...

The staff was friendly, but I wish that when I make a take-out order through Eat24 at 5 pm and the restaurant is empty, I didn't have to wait 15 more minutes after showing up 15 minutes after the order has been submitted (and prepaid).
author: Matthew C.

description: I am so happy found this place, I am from Nepal and I am very critical to food from my country. I always found the food here tasted more Indian than Nepali ( Indian food are spicier and they use a lot of masala ). Don't get me wrong I love Indian food as well. We ordered Buff momo, Chicken momo and chilli momo, And finally my hunt for best momo ends here !! Both Buff and Chicken momo are to die for. Chilli momo has little too much sauce for my liking. But overall a satisfied experience
author: Shreeza S.

description: We were the only ones in the restaurant and they forgot to punch in our food. We waited for 35 mins and as other people filled the restaurant and started getting their food, the waiter saw me and came up to me and asked me "can I take your order." I said, you took my order 40 mins ago. The worst part was my girlfriend and I were excited to try the place for our first visit there. Such a shame. Save your money and your time.
author: Ujjwal T.

description:
I wanted to get something a little different and this place was just what I needed. The flavor, offerings, service, and presentation all went above and beyond. 

My wife and I started with a plate of fried cauliflower. It had a sweet, almost chinese-style sauce flavoring but was really soft and tasty and honestly almost a meal unto itself. 

We then tried the Buffalo Momo (dumplings), a really unique, rich flavor served with a very subtle yellow curry sauce that paired really well. Really good. By this time the host had come by and had a pleasant conversation with us, let us try a little of the Chardonnay he had in stock, and made sure everything was okay. Nice guy. I ordered a Pino Noir (I think?) that had a bit of spice to it, not too much tannin, and went really well with the dumplings.

We finished our night with an entree chicken platter (I think they described it as "a common Nepalese dish") which was similar to Indian meals I've had but beautifully presented and with really unique and subtle flavors.

The host overheard that a friend of ours would be visiting Nepal, and commented that he would be happy to offer some suggestions "better than Lonely Planet's." I believe him.

Will definitely come back for more.
author: Abe D.

description:
Have been wanting to try Gorkha Kitchen since they moved in, but we don't go out to eat much.

Very friendly and helpful. We didn't experience the slow derive others have mentioned in their reviews, although I would call it "leisurely" as in "they didn't hurry US."

Nisha was our waitress, and she was very friendly, knowledgeable and helpful. One member of our party has a problem with too much spice.  As everyone knows, no two people's terminology will work for both parties; what's "mild" and what's "medium"? For those who try the delicious chicken momos, Nisha called them "mild," and for me they were. For our friend they were at the edge of her tolerance! When we chatted with Nisha about that, she said that with the exception of the Tandoor items, anything on the menu could be customized to taste, and she seemed totally capable of figuring out where on the "heat scale" a patron was.

Warning: if you order for "family style," make sure YOU are all in agreement before you order! :)

Another thing to note is that the portions are generous. The Himalayan Salad was more than enough for two of us to share, and the Naan are very good sized. For us, Gorkha's fried rice and three Naan for four people left a lot to be taken home.
author: Lawrence R.

description:
Food is amazing. 

I saw a baby grow into an old man, live a full life and die, surrounded by his grandchildren long before the first plate came out. His final words were, "My rice never came." 

He was the only person I could fully and truly empathize with, and I never knew his name.
author: Matt P.

description:
We went with my pals in the city. The Sakahari Momo's and veg pakora were delish!!!

The chowmein was very tasty (like how it's made in Delhi/India with that special sauce).

Loved the Malai kofta and tea...the staff are very friendly. No attitude, what's so ever!

Will totally come back when I visit the city!
author: Vijey A.

description: We came here for dinner and were seated right away. The papad and chutney as a starter was a nice touch. Gobi Manchurian is a little spicy, but was cooked really well (crispy, vegetable ratio on-point). The Chicken Tikka Masala was standard, but the real star was the Chicken Momos!  The outside wrappers are just awesome, much better than the ones at NeWa and Palace Indian. The servers were very accomodating and courteous, will definitely be back again soon!
author: Farhan N.

description:
This place is amazing. Great food and friendly service. 
My friends and I are regulars now. The server even knows our orders each time we come. Mine is Butter Chicken, spicy. Sooooo good!!! He is always polite and always smiling. :) Never demand tips just genuine friendly service (we still tip though lol) 
I come here with my friends at least twice a month for their lunch special.
I highly recommend this place.!!! 
YAAAAASSSS!!
author: Joselinne E.

description: We came in for lunch on a Monday. Service was very good. Food was great. I have tried a lot of Indian places which all tend to be heavily seasoned that can almost give you a heartburn (I like Indian food). I ordered the eggplant dish today. It was like a mixed stew of veggies. It tasted great with a hint of sweetness because of tomatoes. It s not heavy at all, delicately flavored but still good with rice and nann. My husband ordered the goat dish, it was tender and seasoned with just right amount of flavor (not salty). Oh, and the buff momo (dumplings) was the best.
author: Hannah S.

description: Came here for dinner and everything was delicious! Started with the vegetarian chili momo (the sweet and spicy sauce was addicting). Ordered the aloo gobi, paneer tikka masala, butter chicken, coconut rice and garlic naan. We loved every dish. It was all perfectly seasoned and not too spicy. I recommend getting the coconut rice versus regular basmati rice, it went well with every dish we got. Glad this place is in the neighborhood, I will definitely come back again!
author: Stacey M.

description:
I've tried the Lamb dish for lunch, it was one of my favorite dishes that I had recently! The service was excellent and the prices are very reasonable.
Highly recommend!
author: Matan B.

description:
Ok- this street address has been rapidly changing storefronts for years now, but Gorkha Kitchen is awesome. They're 3 months into doing business, according to the host last night, and my friend and I had a seamless, delicious meal.  

The MoMo dumplings are unique, the dipping sauce is spicy but not overpowering. Very tasty- they said they're Himalayan/Nepalese. My friend commented that the spice was strong in the sauce, so they brought her a mango lassi to cut the capsaicin, on the house! 

The chicken muglai was delicious, small pieces, moist and flavorful, on the bone. The fried rice was incredible! Something that simple which stands out deserves props. Not sure what their secret is but I could eat the fried rice again rn. The pakora (pakorae?) were great, maybe a little soggy but the flavor was the best I've tasted for pakora. 

The hospitality went above and beyond- they stopped by to ask how the meal was and to answer any questions.

SF isn't great for Indian food but this is my new place. FYI it has many standard Indian dishes, it's not only Himalayan food, and they're happy to walk you through the differences. Highly recommend this for an affordable, very good food fix.
author: Matt Y.

description: The service was good! A little awkward, but the food makes up for it! AMAZING!!! Came here to dine during my visit in SF. BEST INDIAN FOOD I HAVE EVER HAD!!! 10/10 recommend, if you've never had Indian food I recommend ordering their Chicken tikka Masala.
author: Jessica N.

description: with reasonable prices this place is not too bad. However the food is just okay. It's a good option if you're hungry and are close by but the tastes are just ordinary, nothing that makes you go "awwwweenlggbnnkggv". but also not too bad.
author: Helia S.

description: The staff was outstanding! A group of us came for lunch and they were thoughtful and attentive. They went above and beyond. The dishes were reasonable. Try the different naan!
author: Maria E.

description: Momos were ok, but biryani was super bland and not tasty at all. Would not order from again.
author: Amanda C.

description: The food was amazing! We had the butter chicken, garlic naan and sakahari momos. Finger licking good.
author: Menaka B.

description:
Good food. Lamb shank was dry (re-heated), but with a lovely sauce that compensated for the rather dismal meat. Though the menu reads lamb "shanks", there was only one small shank in the serving.

The big problem: It was so COLD in the restaurant. Had to eat with coats on. Colder inside that outside. Hard to enjoy food when you're freezing. They could spend some money to turn on their heating system to make diners more comfortable. Would not return unless it was warmer outside.
author: franny s.

description:
The food made me and my wife sick. I have good reason to believe that it was the food from Gorkha since we both ate a meal together here and we are now both sick. Between this and the raw chicken review further down the page, I can't recommend this place. 

If I hadn't gotten sick, I'd give the food a high rating. It tasted good. But once again, food poisoning is no joke.
author: John M.

description:
Awesome place! I had the tadka daal with rice. It was soooo good! They also served me a lot. I didn't finish my dish, but I got help finishing it. The best garlic naan ever! Also tasted the aloo bodi tama. It was great! I was inspired and tried to make it at home. It just does not compare. It's a great excuse to go back! ;) Tasted the saag, too! Also awesome! 

Btw, the service was also great. Very friendly, attentive and fast service. 

I gotta go back!!!
author: Dixi S.

description: We ordered delivery through Yelp. The delivery took almost 2 hours, and I called (twice) the guy picking up the phone said 10 minutes both times... So I called a third time to see what the hold up was, a woman picked up the phone and hung on me as soon as I said I'm following up on a delivery order! Thinking it was an accident, I called back and they wouldn't pick up the phone! I wasn't mad or rude on the phone either, I was just curious what was going on because I was hungry, and it was a weeknight. The restaurant is 12 minutes away according to google maps, so whats up with a 2 hour wait? We got veggie samosas, saag panner, rice and chicken tikka masala - which the restaurant forgot! The food that we did get was just ok. Samosas were good but saag paneer had no flavor. Better Indian places around.
author: Ella M.

description: I'm really sad to write this review. It's all about customer service. I went today  there around 3:30pm . They are open that time . Girl came to me . She said they are close . I know she is lying too me . Because there is not Custmor that time . She don't wanna give service to only me . Very bad service. Do not recommend this restaurant.
author: Carlo S.

description: Finally a Nepalese restaurant in the Sunset. The food is really good. They have authentic Nepalese momo (dumplings), which are ME approved. Overall the ambiance is nice and the restaurant gives a nice and fancy vibe without hurting too much on your wallet. I recommend asking for Nepalese food and to ignore the Indian food. Just to try something new.
author: Ashish N.

description:
amazing food! got samosas for appetizers which were huge and delicious, and got chicken tikka masala and got tofu saag which was something i hadn't tried before. i absolutely loved the tofu saag, it has become my new favorite indian dish!
the server was also very attentive and nice, will definitely be coming back!
author: Natalie R.

description:
Food and service is really awesome....
I had ordered c momo chicken, goat curry, bulllet naan and kathmandu style chowmein. 
I never had such taste in the whole bay area. The service is just too homely and friendly. 
I will try their kingfisher draft beer with some good appetizers.
author: RaZan L.

description: This restaurant serves the best Nepalese cuisine. I love their food and  very good service. The ambiance is beautiful typical Nepalese style which makes me feel like I am home for a while I mean in Kathmandu, Nepal. Keep it up guys. Thanks for the great experience. Hope to be there soon again.
author: Gurung J.

description:
First of all, I really wanted to like this place. It has replaced Curry Village, which was a good Indian restaurant at the outset, but was killed by the indifference of the owners, and their poor health scores.

We've been talking about trying Gorka, so we finally did last weekend.  I'd like to report it was good but, alas, it was mediocre at best. On Saturday evening, around 7:00PM, it was pretty crowded, but we got a table. In general the staff was nice, but clearly they are not well-versed in service skills. After we ordered we sat and waited for 45 minutes, not a moment less, for our food. Not once did a staff member come over to offer us anything at all while we waited, nor did they speak to us at all.  Finally, I told one of them that we'd been waiting 45 minutes, and a minute later the food came out.

We had Saag Paneer, which was very good, and definitely the best order we received.  Garlic nan was just so-so.  The goat curry and lamb rogan josh both lacked any discernible flavor.  Neither was "bad", but neither was at all memorable.  

Considering the ridiculous wait, the rather clueless staff, and the lack of flavor in the food, we will not be returning.  There are too many other options to waste time and money on mediocrity.
author: Baba D.

description:
Decided to try this place with a friend after seeing the good reviews and most other places in the area had long lines. Regrets it after.

Service was a bit slow in the beginning with giving us the menu and water after sitting down- not much of a issue when you have company, but not what I expected after reading some of the reviews. Water served was also lukewarm.

Ordered the chicken momo, dal platter, and garlic naan, which seemed to be popular from the pics. This took awhile to come out- again not in a rush so didn't mind it as much. Chicken momo was good. Haven't had dumplings in an Indian restaurant before. The dal platter was disappointing however. We only finished the rice (with curry that we ordered later on) and the chicken side. The greens and beans? Curry on the platter was still half full when we left. 

We still felt unsatisfied so we decided to order a butter chicken curry to go with the rest of the naan and rice. This came out a lot faster than expected. It was okay but was not the best butter chicken I've had. They offered complimentary rice refills which was nice.

However towards the end of the meal, our stomach wasn't feeling that great and we regret getting that butter chicken afterwards. We just wanted to go straight home at that point.

staff was friendly but was overall disappointed with the meal. Would give another star if I didn't get sick after
author: serene h.

description: In terms of quality of food, this place is a decent Indian/Himalayan option. Victor G. is right in that this place is mainly Indian, other than the momos, which we didn't try. The flavors here are strong, and the chicken is tender, albeit a little salty. The chicken 65 is a great appetizer reminiscent of a chicken curry with larger chunks of meat and outside of the normal bowl of curry. Garlic naan is slightly on the bland side, and masala's are heavy. Service is a little on the slow side, even on a Sunday afternoon. I do feel a little bad for these guys. In the back, they have their own little nap area, where I saw two cooks/waiters napping next to the kitchen. Might be back, but the mains are definitely on the more expensive end of Indian/Himalayan food at about $14/entree.
author: Danny C.

description: Very slow service and mediocre food. We won't be back. We took our last dish with us as it wasn't ready until an hour and a half after we arrived.
author: Seth C.

description: Came here a week night with my boyfriend - it was a bit less casual than I expected (nice tableware, formal sit down & service, etc.) but must say the food was great and high quality! And not too expensive for what we intended to be a very casual meal. Only reason I'm giving it 4 stars is because the atmosphere wasn't quite what I expected- we were one of 3 groups in the whole restaurant. That said, perhaps it was due to it being a little later or there was a sports game going on ;) the upside --a peaceful meal & exceptional service! Our waitress was attentive and sweet, as were the other employees. A waiter even came over to answer a question I had about the wine and his recommendation was on point. Although the restaurant was mostly empty, the kind people and wonderful food made it feel warm :) would go here again.
author: Chelsea D.

description: My girlfriend and I were out in SF for Valentines week and we stumbled upon here. Food was flavorful and the wine deal they had made our dinner date better. We ordered the organic chicken curry, the veggie Gorkha fried rice and garlic naan. As we waited for our entree's, we got the momo appetizer! Bomb af! We recommend this restaurant if you enjoy eating good food.
author: Randy S.

description:
We ordered a variety for Father's Day. It lasted us four days of meals as the helpings are large. Momos - I had never heard of them. They are a must. The vegetarian momos were great and my husband loved the chili chicken momos. The kids liked the plain chicken so win all around. The saag paneer was good and the curry vegetables were delicious. The tandoori chicken was good for the entire family and well done. The dessert was delicious. 

The Himalayan chamin (chow mein) had a great flavor Id just prefer chow mean noodles over spaghetti but the taste was delicious. 

I will eat here often.
author: Monique P.

description: Delicious!  We went in on a quiet Wednesday afternoon. The service was prompt, the restaurant was impeccably clean and the food was authentic!  This is a must do!
author: Hollie W.

description: Amazing veggie momo's. Glad to find this place.. ordered chai as well, which is really good. First customer here, owner let me eat even before inauguration
author: D G.

description: Food here is excellent: had the bhindi, baingan burtha, malai kofta and saag chicken, as well as a selection of breads, some rice, and chai. Delicious all round, not super heavy and really flavorsome. Not too busy and easy to get a table. Only small comment: restaurant was a little cool so bring a sweater (or order chai)
author: Gaurav V.

description: The two of us had the Buffalo Momo, Goat Sekuwa and Dal Bhat Tarkari. The Momo and Sekuwa were really standout dishes and I highly recommend trying them on your first visit. Their flavors were complex and had the right amount of spice. The Dal Bhat Tarkari (platter) with chicken is also good and an excellent choice for sharing. Served with lentils, rice, yogurt, chutney and naan, the entree gives a little bit of everything. The serving sizes were perfect and it was reasonably priced. This is a must try in the Sunset.
author: JN W.

description:
Himalayan Buffalo Dumplings. Amazing. 
Lunch special is a fantastic deal: food is plentiful, delicious and authentic.

This place is a winner.
author: Sarah S.

description:
Gorkha kitchen was absolutely delicious! We had the chicken momas, chicken tikka masala, goat curry, sahi paneer, garlic naan, and basmati rice. 
Everything was exceptional... my favorite was the Sahi paneer... so delicious

The staff alone will have me coming back! The amazing food is just a plus. Everyone was so genuine and helpful to us. They went out of their way to provide a great dining experience and we left feeling happy. I wish I could give 1000000 stars :-) 

Thank you for everything Gorkha Kitchen! We will definitely be back!
author: Annie C.

description: Best delivery food we have ever had!  Apart from the kind smiling delivery gentlemen the food was very tasty!  Our family had the tikki masala, salmon, rice with lemon and broccoli, the naan with garlic cilantro.... all was so very good, tasty and the fact that the owner wanted to get our food to us so it was not cold was an extra plus!!!  Can't wait to go to the actual restaurant!
author: A. Marie L.

description:
We decided to try out the new place in Inner Sunset and had it delivered to us. So glad we did. The food was amazing, as it needs to be with all the competition in the area. 
Samosas were delicious with just the right amount of spice. Curry was scrumptious. Food came quickly and was warm. Will definitely try It again and next time in person.
author: Xavier P.

description: Enjoyable casual experience. The Tandoori Chicken was scrumptious and the Momos are a great fusion from this northern Indian(with Chinese influences) cuisine. The service was friendly and tastefully imperfect. I went with a friend from India and he was into it, explaining all the menu choices and excited to try Gorkha's version. The table tops have comfy, tasteful chairs, which we liked but if you enjoy family pillowed floor style seating there is an area to authenticate your experience.
author: Ivan M.

description: The best indian and himalayan resturant i have ever visited in bay area. Gorkha kitchen made me and my wife day a memorable with friendly service and and great foods. I loved the buff momo most. Will recommend my friends to have some quality time in gorkha kitchen.
author: Sabir A.

description: Portion is good, flavor is right on point. Atmosphere is quite relaxing and casual. Server and owner came by few times and very friendly.
author: Grace L.

description:
This place is awesome! I was pleasantly surprised by the interior decor, the service was truly incredible, and the food was excellent.

My first time trying momas, which are a must. They're thicker dumplings with an herb forward flavor. So tasty and I really loved the texture of the dumpling wrapper.

Second must order is the butter chicken. I could eat it every day. Perfectly creamy texture and the protein was moist and not dried out like lesser establishments. Nice balance of tartness, sweetness, umami and saltiness from the naan.

Docked a star for slightly longer wait times.

Can't wait to go back with a big crew. Keep up the good work!
author: Rob C.
