description: I love this restaurant it has the best decor and the food is amazing i felt like home they had a best hospitality the moment i walked in i was greated with a smile  i love momo its amazing n i would recomand everyone to try i had a goat curry as my main course as soon as i took a bite i felt the brust of flavours exploding in my mouth was seasoned perfectly the meat was tender and it came with rice the price was also resonable i love this place and i would come back again
author: Bipin S.

description: Fun to have a Nepalese restaurant in the sunset. Interesting menu items. Vegan friendly.
author: J P.

description: Gorkha offers a nice combination of Himalayan and Indian cuisine, so you get to eat your usual chicken tikki masala with a plate of less usual momo dumplings.  Food is delicious and ambiance is nicer than some former occupants.
author: Candice B.

description:
Gorkha Kitchen was great! 

We got the Samosas for an Appetizer, Lamb Vindaloo, Chicken Tikka Masala and a few Naans. Everything was tasty and was definitely a lot of food for just two of us.

The Tikka Masala is a tiny bit sweet, but it hit the spot pretty well.
author: Jeffrey M.

description: Awesome experience! Sat down at the low tables with the rug and pillows after taking our shoes off. Ordered the traditional everyday Nepalese meal (Dal Baht Tarkari) and it was enough to split between me and my boyfriend. It was delicious! Definitely going to be coming back here again!
author: Eva D.

description: Amazing food! You can tell how fresh are their ingredients, peaceful atmosphere and prime service!
author: Malu R.

description: Awesome Indian / Nepalese food. Really great service and will come back again! Oh and pretty good wine too to calm them spiced up taste buds :)
author: Nikhil D.

description:
I love this place.  We've been there several times and even took our family here when they visited from out of town.  My dad said it was the best Indian he's ever had, and he's picky AF.

We love the Madras Chicken and the Chana Masala, but we've honestly never had a bad dish here.  The mango lassis are amazing and have such rich flavor.

I hope this place does well!  Definitely check them out!
author: John H.

description: The chili chicken/gobi are both fantastic. The service is great, and the owner/manager is incredibly nice. It was raining outside when we left and he was going to do a delivery up the street and offered to give us a ride home! It felt like living in a small town again.
author: Garrett S.

description: IMHO the BEST North Indian food I have had in the Bay Area!
author: Rajeev S.

description: It was aight.  Cleaner/lighter tasting than naan and curry with similar prices and more diverse menu
author: Joe M.

description: Great lunch deal! Rice, naan, lentils and salad all come with the main course. Everything tasted very good and was served pretty fast. Very clean and nicely decorated as well.
author: Niklas K.

description: Excellent food at a very reasonable cost. The service was exceptional but what we loved most about the place was the authenticity of the food which was very rich in flavor and plentiful in proportions ! Not trendy like so many other new places in SF.
author: Wesley W.

description: Really stellar food. We usually get takeout, but the few times we've eaten in the service had also been on point. Usually the dining room isn't too busy so you can get seated immediately.
author: Alex S.

description: I've been to Gorkha Kitchen twice now, and both times it has been delicious and flavorful! I love the gobi munchurian (lightly fried califlower in chili sauce), momo dumplings, and of course garlic naan. When you go, I highly recommend asking your server for their thoughts and recommendations for your order. The servers know their menu so well and they will steer you in the right direction! Service is also prompt but they don't rush you - your food is served on a warmed tray so that it stays hot and you can take your time. This will remain one of my go-to neighborhood spots!
author: Alissa S.

description: Excelente mi gente :) dishes or cook to perfection and the service was superb. We had classic palak paneer and chicken tikka masala which was
author: Paulina P.

description: Very tasty food. The staff was extremely nice and very helpful. I believe it was the owner who checked on us to ensure everything was good.
author: Luis L.

description:
This is the best restraunt i have visited for indian food in United States until today.
I loved the coconut curry blend and the shahi paneer.
The naan is perfectly cooked to eat. Loved the lassi too.
author: Garvit M.

description: We tried Gorkha Kitchen during our trip to SF this summer and I couldn't resist to share my wonderful experience with everyone on yelp. We ordered chicken momo and chicken biryani, and they were some of the best I've had in the US, and I should know since I'm a Nepali and am pretty picky when it comes to Nepali and Indian cuisine. The ambiance and cleanliness of the restaurant just added to our experience and the wait was pretty quick. Overall, a great experience and would highly recommend to try it out if you're in the area.
author: Sangam R.

description:
Very poor service. The waiter asked for our order and at some point we lost him, he literally looked away and tuned us out in the middle of ordering! He heard the 1st 3 items and was checked out for the remaining 2 (plain rice and naan). He then came back to earth and said, "do you want rice?" Really ? He read back the order to us. 
When the food arrived one dish was wrong! So the kitchen messed up? 
Food was not fresh and the naan was stale. The Tikka Masala was really sweet ...yuk! Tasted like sauce from a jar. The decor  and music was cheesy. Prices were high for cafeteria style food.  There's much better places to eat Indian food. The frozen TJ's Indian food is even a step above. Don't waste your money. If I get sick tonight, I'm taking a star away!
author: Lulu S.

description: Tofu saag hit the spot! I was so shocked to find vegan saag but glad I came across this spot! Nice level of spice but for those of you who can't handle it I would ask to make it less spicy. Solid portion size too(for delivery). Will definitely come back to this spot :)
author: Raman D.

description: My food still had not come by the time my husband was finishing his.   When I was finally able to flag someone down ,  they insisted that it was almost done.   15 minutes later they rush out with the wrong food.  When I tried to point it out they insisted that I somehow don't know the difference between tofu and chicken.   It might help if anyone wrote anything down from orders to reservations.   I'm baffled by all the 5 star reviews.  The service was horrible, the floor was really dirty,  and I got the wrong food...???
author: Morgan S.

description:
Sorry to write this review since I wanted to like it based on the high rating and love South Asian food.

Had takeout.

I ordered the chicken momos and they were undercooked and possibly raw (the dough for the dumplings was still elastic like uncooked dough). Hard to tell if the ingredients were raw or not since there's a lot of sauce in the dumplings. I ate one entire dumpling and my partner ate half of one until we realized the dumplings were not cooked thoroughly. There was another review that noted that their momo appetizer was undercooked or raw as well. Maybe the feedback hasn't gotten back to the cooks.

Had the spicy chicken appetizer and was not overly impressed. We ended up throwing it away after a few bites. Sauce tasted like there was a lot of tabasco.

Also ordered the aloo gobi and chicken vindaloo. Both were decent but there are better renditions of the dishes in other Indian restaurants in town. The portions were pretty big for both.
author: t t.

description:
Best Indian/Nepali food in San Francisco. This place is very clean and welcoming with nice sitting area.
I was incredibly happy with the food and the service here.Excellent food and a very friendly staff.
Everything tasted fresh. Texture was excellent with the right amount of spices and doesn't over do it in the cream or salt area as many Americanized-Indian restaurants tend to do.
Gorkha Kitchen is a great place to be if you're ready for some authentic Himalayan and Indian food along with great service.
Highly recommended.
author: Manish T.

description: The owner reached out to me after I posted my first review and refunded my purchase fully, so I added a star to my initial review.
author: Mariana R.

description: I visited Gorkha Kitchen with my family last week. Everything we ordered (butter chicken, palak paneer, butter naan, chicken tandoori and goat curry) was very flavorful and delicious. Their decor is also very traditional and they have a separate area with traditional seating available for bigger groups! Give Gorkha Kitchen a try and you will not be disappointed at all!!
author: Shradha M.

description:
I was honestly hoping for better; especially with their pricing but I am afraid that the Rogan Josh and Bengan Bharta were mediocre at best... for the money Roti in West Portal is
MUCH better value, quality and flavors... momos were ok I guess.
author: Larry C.

description: The service was quite slow. The food was unremarkable. Bones in meat dishes that were dangerous. Ambiance was nice.
author: Grant S.

description:
I visited Gorkha Kitchen for the first time yesterday and was blown away by the fabulous food and amazing service.  The restaurant was especially accomodating to my vegan friend and I.  I asked for meat or fish and vegetables with no grains.  They made we a special Tandoori plate that included lamb chops, chicken, cauliflower, and other vegetables with a lovely sauce on the side.  I will definitely return.

I noticed one review said the food took a long time.  Does that reviewer realize that they prepare everything fresh?  The quality as well as taste of the food was outstanding, and we were told it would take a few minutes to prepare.  It was well worth the wait!
author: Beth E.

description: Gorkha is my new favorite restaurant in the inner sunset. Food is excellent - takes on traditional Indian and Himalayan food but without overdoing it on the grease. Lots of great flavors, friendly staff, reasonably priced for SF. Highly recommend.
author: David C.

description: Delicious delicious food. Fresh and flavorful. Nice service and quiet atmosphere (Sunday early dinner). We loved the saag paneer and chicken tikka kabob. And Everest momos!!
author: Julia A.

description:
Lived in the sunset all my life. Definitely the best Indian place I've had here ever. Been here a few times and has never disappointed. Chicken tikka masala is always on point.

Service is always terrific as well!
author: Alexander C.

description: This is a very good Indian place.  We really liked the butter chicken.  It was tender and tasty.  The Naan was one of the best that I have ever had.  The service was very attentive.  I would come back again.
author: Guiness C.

description: Really wanted to love this place. We have ordered from them about five times now in the last two months. There has been an issue almost every single time: wrong items being delivered, getting a call 10 mins before the promised delivery time saying the items were sold out, delivery time of 1.5-2 hours (happened twice). Every time I think to myself well maybe it was just a bad night or maybe a driver called in sick. But it seems to be an ongoing issue and we're just fed up. The food is great. We order the vegetarian dishes and they're awesome. We will be finding a new Indian restaurant to order from.
author: Anya K.

description: Delicious and a very friendly staff! The Nepalese platter was so good and the Spicy Momo is a definite repeat!
author: Brandi D.

description:
The place has great ambiance, perfect for family or dinner with someone special. The Tandoori Chicken is fantastic and has so much flavor, Chicken tikka masala was creamy and the sauce was delicious. I like how they have various option on vegetable dish,  We ordered Tofu Spinach and Aloo Gobi Vegan which was right amount of portions and very delicious. 

Thank you our service was friendly, Quick and solicitous. We are definitely coming back again
author: Bandu M.

description:
Vegan Delight!

Wow, and you thought you couldn't have it all. A nice, surprisingly upscale ambiance, excellent food with numerous, clearly-labeled vegan options (plenty of non-vegan options as well), and reasonable rates. Yes, yes, and yes. So happy to have been introduced to this place by a friend. Here are some details of our visit:

Starters - They bring out a plate of papadam with a couple of dipping sauces. From the sauces I already knew this was going to be a great meal - the best tamarind sauce I've had in a while.

Appetizers - Samosas: crispy, but not oily, flavorful without being overwhelming. These were excellent.

Mains - Tofu Sag: My favorite Indian dish before becoming a vegan was paneer sag ... I have since eschewed it in lieu of sag daal or other variations and have found some good ones, but nothing that compares with this. It is not only the best sag I've had since becoming a vegan, it is the best sag I've ever had, period. The stuff of dreams. If you like spinach, you must get this dish.

Chow Mein Kathmandu Style: I did not expect this at a "Indian" restaurant and so we thought we'd give it a try. This dish was good, but nothing special. The seasoning was light, and would appeal to those who like more delicate flavors. However, in my opinion it could have done with more vegetables.

Side: Roti: The roti did not disappoint and was an excellent accompaniment to the sag.

Service: Very attentive and friendly. Great staff.

Atmosphere: Nice. Much better than the prices would suggest and certainly a step up in comparison with most "Indian" restaurants. You could dress up and bring a date here (though we were perfectly comfortable in street clothes).

* Note: I put "Indian" in quotation marks because this is technically a Himalayan/Nepalese restaurant, but many of the dishes overlap with those found in Indian restaurants which will be more familiar to most readers.
author: Candan S.

description:
First time here ... tried both the chicken and veg Momos and they were pretty good.  The dipping sauce was very tasty.

We also tried the tiki chicken masala, bharta, and saag.  The price of each entree was on the high side $13.99 - $19.99 but the food was very flavorful.  I would say give this place a try.
author: Jennifer T.

description: Gorkha Kitchen was ok. I enjoyed my tofu paneer & basmati rice but my dining partner was not thrilled with the appetizer, Chicken 65, or entrée, Masala Chicken. "The spiciness was there in each dish, but they were just too sweet; the only saving grace was the salty lassi" per my friend.
author: Debbie E.

description: Not my favorite. Ordered the lamb vindaloo, garlic naan and veggie biryani. The vindaloo was a bit soupy, too liquidity for my taste and sparse on the potatoes. The meat itself was soft. Garlic naan was flavorful but soggy, likely due to food delivery . What I found most troublesome was the rice dish. I was somewhat surprised to find nuts in the dish, that should be included in the description. Apart from the nuts I spent time pulling whole cloves out of my mouth and hard bits of whole spices. The rice itself was a little bland, needing salt, and very mushy.
author: Cynthia D.

description: This is my new favorite for Indian in the area! The tikka masala was creamy and cooked perfectly and there are so many naan options. Super attentive waiters and awesome service. Can't wait to go back again for something else on their menu.
author: Kate G.

description: Absolutely amazing food! I overeat every time I come here because it's that good. The design is definitely well executed with a very authentic decor. You also have the option to do a sit down dining experience like they do in Nepal which is very unique if you have never done it. Overall it's a 10/10 and if you go I'd highly recommend ordering desert
author: Howard R.

description: This would be my third time at Gorkha Kitchen which really isn't a kitchen but a super nice dining experience with those very personable friendly Nepali's.   The food every time was so delicious and the portions are really great!  I love the dal bhat...as if you were in Nepal for it.  The special Everest momos with the special chicken and spices are super tasty..delicious.   I highly recommend and intend to go there again...and again...and again!!  They have a great lunch special too that will fill you to your hearts content if you are vegetarian or meat lover...
author: Tracy T.

description: The food was super flavorful. The service was very attentive and wonderful. The buff momos were the star of the show and the chicken tikka massala was its side kick, sooo good. This is the best Nepalese food I've had in the Bay Area. Wish we lived closer, I'd be a regular. Oh well I guess it'll give me more excuses to head into this neighborhood.
author: Jennifer L.

description: My favorite restaurant in the city! Super nice staff, the food is incredibly flavorful, and the quality exceeds the price by a landslide! Highly recommend the momo, chicken tikka masala, and any type of naan.
author: James D.

description: The best service with the freshest and most delicious food. Absolutely fantastic and I can't wait to go back and share this treasure with others!
author: Ashley F.

description: This place is awesome. Love the garlic naan and tikka masala - chichen and veg!
author: Danielle M.

description: Good food with reasonable pricing .. a bit work for the parking though.. but food was worth it for the price and the hassel.. would definitely go there again. Different taste than the other indian and himalayan resturant . Servicer was very nice  and very polite and patient with us . A 5 star worthy resturant with nice food and people ..
author: Anil G.

description:
I highly recommend this restaurant. Great food, ambiance and very attentive service!! Come even to see the expensive dishware. ;)
Best goat curry and tandoori cauliflower!
author: Angela P.

description: Haven't tasted the food yet because I'm still waiting for them to finish my to-go order. Quoted 20m and now 35m and counting at 9:10p on a Tuesday. ....will update if the Zombie Apocalypse doesn't happen first
author: Sean R.

description:
I live in the neighborhood and am so excited to have Gorkha nearby! The staff could not have been more friendly. They were very polite and attentive. 

We got samosas, tandoori cauliflower, chicken tikka masala, butter naan and garlic naan. The food was delicious and everything had a ton of flavor. The tikka masala sauce was creamy and had a unique touch to it, maybe cinnamon? Whatever it was, it was delicious and I will definitely be back!
author: Kelly K.

description: The food was not bad but the owner is a real sleaze bag. He advertises one glass of wine with an entree and then bring one glass for my friend and I. When I told him where is the other glass he boasted about how he worded the ad in such a way just to deceive people. Not good business ethics and will never go back. Owner ruined my entire experience and I didn't enjoy my food.
author: Ari B.

description: Stopped by for lunch and loved the ambiance. Feels fancy but not terribly expensive. The food was delicious and I'm definitely coming back to try more.
author: Albina K.

description: Food quality is really good. Bit expensive compared to other Indian places though. Recommend their Gorkha bhat daal item. Also the ambience adds to the theme nicely.
author: Shimul B.

description: The place is good for the first time but later when we started visiting often the food started getting worse. They served chicken tikka masala sweet and when asked about it gave not a reasonable explanation.
author: Aprajita S.

description: The food was terrible, the chicken tikka masala and shahi paneer had the same sauce and were super sweet.. decent ambience and pleasant wait staff. Not going back for sure
author: Mustafa N.

description: Very nice food. Excellent customer service, very welcoming environment. I really love the food flavor. Have  not tried really authentic Nepali food in a long time. Would definitely be coming back.
author: Gressa T.

description: This was a great neighborhood find. Different and unique from other Indian cuisine I have had. As a vegetarian there were many choices but my family also happily got the goat curry which they loved!  Don't miss the Moma appetizer.
author: Eve C.

description:
The best Indian restaurant we'hv ever been to , great service and the food was to delicious .
Definitely be back 
Thank you gorkha kitchen
author: Krishna K.

description: Great service! And the food is amazing. Reasonable prices and a great ambiance. The garlic naan and chicken tikka masala are our favorites. Even the house wine that they sell by the glass (for $5) is great. Lum is the best server and host. He remembered us our second time in and he made us feel extra special! FIVE STARS! There needs to be more places like this.
author: Amanda B.

description: This place is great. Absolutely loved the food, very tasty. Staff are very friendly and service was pretty fast. We tried the momo, goat sekuwa and chicken tikka masala. Momo was juicy and the side sauce was great. Goat sekuwa was very tender and just the right amount of spices. Chicken was very soft, creamy and tasty. Will visit again. Probably the best South Asian food in Sunset.
author: Marcus R.

description: Such tasty food and wonderful staff! We ordered 2 curries and the Buffalo Momos. My friends and I were most impressed with the chutney sauce that came with the momos, spicy and a distinct flavor. Butter Chicken and Eggplant curries were also delicious. And the Naans were so fluffy and filling. Would definitely eat here again!
author: V YCucu C.

description: Veggie chili momos were awesome and unique in taste; naan was excellent; curries were good and not oily; great atmosphere; and friendly staff. Owner greeted folks and seems passionate about restaurant & giving good service/food. Would definitely go back! Breath of fresh air for the neighborhood!
author: Mahesh N.

description: This is my first yelp review in over 15 years.  I love this restaurant. Can't express to you how delicious and fresh everything is!! You won't be disappointed. I m fighting a cold tried the Himalayan chicken noodle soup. Mind blown! So tasty, subtle curry Nepalese spices, chicken, noodles perfectly cooked not soggy. Try this restaurant people, it's legit.  Real hospitality in the Inner Sunset. They create an experience.
author: Elizabeth B.

description:
Great food, super friendly service! So far they've been out of the rasmalai every time I've come in, but the gulab jamun was a delicious substitute. A little expensive, but definitely the best Indian food in the neighborhood. Worth it for me since I'm super picky and love the convenience of living around the block.

Stuff comes pretty darn mild, you may want to bump up your spice order to get it how you like it.
author: Kelly B.

description: We love eating here. They treat us great and the food is excellent. Hot and delicious. They are very nice to our kids as well! We have had take out and delivery also. Overall a really great addition to our neighborhood and wonderful food.
author: Brian P.

description: Our experience was delightful. We had a delicious lunch. The flavors were scrumptious. Highly recommend.
author: Don F.

description: We love Indian/himalayan food and this is the best we had so far! Great ambiance, very friendly staff and the food was so delicious and fresh! We shared the vegetables dumplings, I had the chow mein Kathmandu style and my wife had the classic chicken tikka masala. The food was cooked just right! The portion sizes were enough for two meals...we are going to enjoy the leftovers for lunch tomorrow!
author: Livia B.

description: I lived in Nepal some years ago and now love to try Nepali food wherever I go. This is some of the best I've had: perfect momos, delicious curries, succulent sag, buttery naan, flavorful kheer, and a bright and unique pickled vegetable side. Make this one of your neighborhood stapes - you don't be disappointed. Dhanyebaad, Gorkha Kitchen team, for a delicious meal!
author: Sarah H.

description: I love Indian cuisine! While visiting friends in San Francisco I wanted to try a place they hadn't been before and this place was in walking distance. There was another restaurant across the street, but this one was only one with true vegan options. The decor was beautiful and I loved the signage and design of the entrance. The service was great. Our server, who seemed to be the lead, took great care of my friends and I. We ordered a little of everything and even when we made a mistake the server was nice enough to take it back and replace the dish for us. The food was very good, even my friends were pleasantly surprised. My only complaint was the chana masla seemed a little undercooked. I like my chickpeas tender to the bite, almost like it melts in your mouth. That's just a personal preference, but other than that, everything else was on point. Definitely I will be revisiting this place whenever I'm around the area.
author: DeShaun W.

description: Best Himalayan food I've had in San Francisco! Great customer service and the owner was extremely inviting. The butter chicken melted in my mouth and it is organic and non GMO (owner even showed me!). Vegan dishes were spectacular and we can't wait to go back with our friends!!
author: Rebecca W.

description: Food was excellent!  We ordered Butter chicken, Prawns curry, garlic naan, coconut madras rice, chicken Tikki Masala). Their hours are supposed to be from 11am, and we arrived at 11am, but they weren't ready to open until 11:15am because they still had to clean the floors and tables (from the night before?). Anyway, despite the little wait, food was delicious. Will come again and try something else.
author: Karen L.

description: great food, great service, and really comfortable vibe!!! enjoyed everything. the buttered chicken and lamb tandoori were amazing. the chicken dumplings were amazing. try all those
author: Samantha W.

description: This is probably the best Nepalese dish, I have in long time. I was not hungry but when I saw this new restaurant, I wanted to give a try and tried their Kathmandu style chowmein and momo. Chowmein was delicious and less oily. momo was juicy and liked their momo's  chutney. Staffs are friendly and very knowledgeable, excellent ambience with soft music on background. Perfect place for date. I would definitely go back with my friends and family and highly recommend this place.
author: Aj K.

description: Gorkha has been very consitent with the quality of their food. Everyone I've brought here has loved it, and it quickly became my favorite indian restaurant in the city. Most of the waiters and staff are friendly also, and very hospitable. The vibe in the restaurant is also great!
author: Jessie K.

description: We had the butter chicken, Tikka Masala, and goat curry.  All were delicious, but the two chicken dishes were really delicious. We order Tikka Masala a lot and the one at Gorkha Kitchen is one of the best.
author: Lucas A.

description: This is one of my favorite Indian Restaurant around San Francisco area. Great food, great location. Service was really good. I have been there couple times with my friends and family... highly recommended...
author: Prajapati L.

description: Good food ! Staff absolutely wonderful!  My mom and I will for sure be back to explore the other dishes in the menu.
author: Pratibha T.

description: This place is fantastic -- a great addition to the neighborhood. We've been multiple times since it opened and everything has been delicious. Complex, fresh flavors in every dish we've tried, nothing too heavy, lots of vegetarian options, and the right amount of spice. Don't miss the vegetarian momos or the dal bhat tarkari platter. The cowherd kheer (Himalayan rice pudding) for dessert is a delight.
author: Kate S.

description: The food is delicious and the service was superb! I can't remember the last time I've been to a restaurant where the staff was so thoughtful. They don't have beer/wine yet but we brought our own wine, no corking fee. The gorkha chili chicken appetizer and baingan bharta were my favorites. Highly recommend!!
author: Mary M.

description: Awesome Veggie dumplings. Also ordered Biryani which i would say not the best but was still good. Food served was hot and a pleasant dining affair. Gorkha staff wears symbol of 2 knives (Kukri) on their hats and which is quite a traditional.
author: Nisarg G.
